page.title: 05ALLOTMENT GARDENS
page.content: At Landport, Malling Cooksbridge and Earwig Corner are{allotment gardens. {People rent}them from the district council for leisure and to grow their own fruit and vegetables. A 10 pole plot costs{Â£16 a year}but there is a waiting list for allotments in Lewes. New allotment holders often find their land very weedy so they have a lot of weeding to do at first. Most people improve their soil by crop rotation and making their vegetable waste into{compost. Manure {can also be bought}from a local farmer and the many riding stables nearby. Harveys brewery provides used{hops}to put on the soil. Many of the sheds were once World War 2 air raid shelters. A lot of the allotment holders are older men but more and more younger men and women are renting them now.
